meta.title: Fort Dodge, Iowa | Fort Dodge Community School District

meta.name: description
meta.content: The Fort Dodge Community School District provides quality learning experiences and develops productive citizens ready for their futures. Learn more!

div.p: Our school district is committed to serving nearly 3,700 K-12 students in the Fort Dodge community and its surrounding areas.Â

li.a: District Mission, Vision, Goals, Beliefs & Values

div.p: OurÂ district is comprised of seven schools whichÂ just like our studentsÂ are diverse with unique personalities.

li.a: Freshman Registration Information from 8th Grade Night

div.p: Our departments provide services and resources that support student learning and growth.

li.a: Bus Driver Jobs at the FDCSD

div.p: We are proud to provide a diverse and accepting atmosphere which enriches the educational opportunities for all of our students.
We have a student population diverse in culture, ability and interests and offer an environment that expands students' understanding of the diverse and culturally abundant world we live in.

img.alt: boy tying bonnet on mom for Moms day

div.p: Our parents are a valued and important piece of each of our student's educational experience.
OurÂ district takes pride in our highly qualified and caring team of staff.

Congratulations to the FDSH boys bowling team on their State Championship and to Kaleb Anderson on his individual championship!
Duncombe Elementary students work on their literacy skills during small group reading instruction
Cooper Elementary students celebrate the 100th day of school by dressing like they are 100 years old and participating in activities around the number 100
Students at Riverside ELCÂ enjoy playing in the snow as part of their learning in the outdoor classroom
FDMS students kicked offÂ Pennies for PatientsÂ with a kindness and compassion assembly where 7 individuals had their hair cut to donate it for wigs for kids
The FDSH Robotics teams participated in a First Tech League competition recently.Â The Dodgerbots moved on to the Super Qualifier!
Butler Elementary kids learnedÂ coding lingo through code.org, and were excited to use their new knowledge to make the drones fly in the Maker Space
FDMS students utilize a study hall to work on their math skills
Feelhaver Elementary students participate in independent reading as part of their literacy learning.Â
Members of the FDSH Women's Chorale are preparing for the annual Pops concert on February 20

div.p:
104 South 17th Street
Fort Dodge, IA 50501

The Fort Dodge Community School District serves over 3,600 students in one early learning center, four elementary schools, one new middle school and one high school. Being a Dodger has become synonymous with a quality and diverse education that allows students to succeed in academics, the visual and performing arts, athletics and various activities.
